body:
The change you linked is due to changes in the diactoros lib. Such internal changes are not documented in the migration guide.

You need to update your tests as required to avoid the error.

issue.title: Fix server data missing when building URI instance and base info

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Fixes #18237

<!---

Please describe the reason for the changes you're proposing. If it is a large change, please open an issue to discuss first.

Always follow the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) when submitting a pull request. In particular, make sure existing tests still pass, and add tests for all new behavior. When fixing a bug, you may want to add a test to verify the fix.

-->

body:
I'm afraid it's not only tests that are affected but also the end-user flow. We don't use internal method (i.e. `ServerRequestFactory:: createUri()`) in tests so not sure what needs adjustment here.

I created a PR for you to take a look - https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/18238

As far as I see this specific error can only occur if you are calling `ServerRequestFactory::fromGlobals()` with the `$server` arg and it doesn't contain the `DOCUMENT_ROOT` key.

Are you creating a request instance yourself even during normal app execution? Cause otherwise `$_SERVER` would be used which *should* have `DOCUMENT_ROOT` set.

> TypeError: str_contains(): Argument #1 ($haystack) must be of type string, null given
> /var/www/passbolt/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Http/UriFactory.php:170

BTW neither [5.0.11](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.0.11/src/Http/UriFactory.php#L164) nor the current `5.x` HEAD has a `str_contains()` call at line `170` of `UriFactory`.

issue.title: Avoid TypeError for str_contains()

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Refs https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/18237
best to check for a non empty input before trying a str_contains() on it.

I am a bit surprised that our STAN tools dont report on sth like this.

body:
I checked the code and no we are not calling `ServerRequestFactory::fromGlobals()` from anywhere (test or source) in the code. However we are calling `Cake\Mailer\Renderer` (as seen in stack trace above) which in turn is trying to generate URI and failing.

> BTW neither [5.0.11](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.0.11/src/Http/UriFactory.php#L164) nor the current 5.x HEAD has a str_contains() call at line 170 of UriFactory.

Yeah I might have added a few lines for testing but I checked the CI output and line no. is 164.
Add a `dd(\Cake\Error\Debugger::trace())` just above the line which has the `str_contains()` call and provide the output for a *normal* request which generates the error.

Here's the output:

```
bin/cake passbolt email_digest send

CORE/src/Http/UriFactory.php (line 163)
########## DEBUG ##########
'Cake\Http\UriFactory::getBase() - CORE/src/Http/UriFactory.php, line 56
Cake\Http\UriFactory::marshalUriAndBaseFromSapi() - CORE/src/Http/ServerRequest.php, line 281
Cake\Http\ServerRequest->_setConfig() - CORE/src/Http/ServerRequest.php, line 249
Cake\Http\ServerRequest->__construct() - CORE/src/View/View.php, line 363
Cake\View\View->__construct() - CORE/src/View/ViewBuilder.php, line 595
Cake\View\ViewBuilder->build() - CORE/src/View/ViewVarsTrait.php, line 66
Cake\Mailer\Renderer->createView() - CORE/src/Mailer/Renderer.php, line 69
Cake\Mailer\Renderer->render() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Utility/Factory/EmailPreviewFactory.php, line 80
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Utility\Factory\EmailPreviewFactory->renderFromEmailEntity() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Utility/Factory/EmailPreviewFactory.php, line 155
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Utility\Factory\EmailPreviewFactory->renderDigestContentFromEmailPreview() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Utility/DigestCollection/SingleDigestCollection.php, line 57
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Utility\DigestCollection\SingleDigestCollection->marshalEmails() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Service/EmailDigestService.php, line 64
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Service\EmailDigestService->createEmailDigests() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Service/SendEmailBatchService.php, line 61
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Service\SendEmailBatchService->sendNextEmailsBatch() - ROOT/plugins/PassboltCe/EmailDigest/src/Command/SenderCommand.php, line 63
Passbolt\EmailDigest\Command\SenderCommand->execute() - CORE/src/Console/BaseCommand.php, line 192
Cake\Console\BaseCommand->run() - CORE/src/Console/CommandRunner.php, line 327
Cake\Console\CommandRunner->runCommand() - CORE/src/Console/CommandRunner.php, line 168
Cake\Console\CommandRunner->run() - ROOT/bin/cake.php, line 12
[main] - [main], line 0'
###########################
```

It's a command which internally calls the `Renderer`.

Following line is the root cause of the issue. When a `ServerRequest` instance is directly created in this manner the doc root is not set.

https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/1094a032bc6eb7aa1317cc693745407b15a099c0/src/View/View.php#L363

One fix would be to initialize `DOCUMENT_ROOT` to `''` if unset similarly:

https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/1094a032bc6eb7aa1317cc693745407b15a099c0/src/Http/ServerRequest.php#L266-L268

@ishanvyas22 What values do you have for `base`, `webroot` and `baseUrl` in app config? Cause with defaults the error doesn't occur even when using `new ServerRequest(['base' => '', 'url' => '', 'webroot' => '/'])` as the execution returns early here https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/1094a032bc6eb7aa1317cc693745407b15a099c0/src/Http/UriFactory.php#L140-L141

Ouch, I see it being commented out in the skeleton
https://github.com/cakephp/app/blob/85b63441af13b21108ced71c21489c6a3133fe80/config/app.php#L58
instead of empty string

could this then run into this for certain scenarios?

> Ouch, I see it being commented out in the skeleton

Having `baseUrl` unset is what you *do* need normally.

> What values do you have for base, webroot and baseUrl in app config?

Here's the values:
`Router::getRequest()` -> `null`
`App.base` -> `false`
`App.baseUrl` -> `'/'`
`App.webroot` -> `webroot`

> One fix would be to initialize DOCUMENT_ROOT to '' if unset similarly:

While running tests we tried setting the `App.base` to `''` empty string and it works but looking at the skeleton it still (in cake5) `false`. So is it something that is not BC? Does skeleton needs adjustment too?

> Does skeleton needs adjustment too?

Yes, don't set `App.baseUrl` (that's the default) unless you have a specific reason to do so.

issue.title: Fix type error.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
When UriFactory::marshalUriAndBaseFromSapi() is called with explicit server params and DOCUMENT_ROOT is not set, default to empty string instead of null.

Closes #18237

<!---

Please describe the reason for the changes you're proposing. If it is a large change, please open an issue to discuss first.

Always follow the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) when submitting a pull request. In particular, make sure existing tests still pass, and add tests for all new behavior. When fixing a bug, you may want to add a test to verify the fix.

-->

body:
Got it, that's the reason then. In the code the `App.baseUrl` is explicitly set in the command ([EmailQueue plugin command](https://github.com/lorenzo/cakephp-email-queue/blob/master/src/Shell/SenderShell.php#L90)). I also see you have a fix already 

Let me check if the fix is working fine.
